structure.unit: SCHOOL EMPLOYEES -- TEACHERS' RETIREMENT AND TENURE

law.text: Five (5) members of the board of trustees shall constitute a quorum. Each trustee shall be entitled to one (1) vote. Four (4) votes or a majority of the trustees present whichever is the larger number shall be necessary for a decision by the trustees at any meeting of the board.
law.history: Repealed and reenacted 1990 Ky. Acts ch. 476, Pt. V, sec. 489, effective July 13, 1990. -- Amended 1974 Ky. Acts ch. 395, sec. 4, effective July 1, 1974. -- Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. sec. 4506b-10.
